snippet: Any moment not shrouded in gold, silver or bronze has the potential to draw complaints, insults and general disgruntlement from fans and the news media.
abstract: Less than half of the more than 200 nations competing in the London Olympic Games have won a medal, but the carping among fans and in the news media is greatest in countries that have won medals; for millions of onlookers, the Olympic experience is largely about the agony of watching their country come up short.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Any moment not shrouded in gold, silver or bronze has the potential to draw complaints, insults and general disgruntlement from fans and the news media.

headline.seo: Olympic Medal Count Can Be Daily Source of Discontent
headline.main: And the Olympic Gold for Whining Goes to ...
headline.print_headline: And the Olympic Gold for Whining Goes to ...
